item.title: ModelingAgent submitted to EMNLP 2025 ðŸ“„
item.description:
We have officially submitted our manuscript “ModelingAgent: Bridging LLMs and Mathematical Modeling for Real-World Challenges” to EMNLP 2025.

Quick links

  • arXiv PDF â€” 2505.15068
  • Codebase â€” https://github.com/qiancheng0/ModelingAgent

The paper introduces ModelingBench, a real-world math-modeling benchmark, and ModelingAgent, a multi-agent framework that coordinates data retrieval, simulation, and self-refinement. Stay tuned for reviewer feedback and camera-ready updates!

item.title: 2 papers accepted to ACL 2025 ðŸŽ‰
item.description:
Great news! Both MultiAgentBench and EscapeBench have been officially accepted to ACL 2025 Main Conference (Vienna, July 2025).

Highlights

  • MultiAgentBench received uniformly positive reviews â€” one reviewer called it “interesting, forward-looking, and visionary,” noting it “fills a critical gap in current multi-agent evaluation.”
  • We will submit the camera-ready version soon and keep updating the codebase & data to make the framework a SWE-bench equivalent for LLM multi-agent research.

Stay tuned â€” this post will be updated with links to the camera-ready PDF and dataset once they are available.
